function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the interaction with home energy management systems in a pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the use of hems technologies and the interaction with end-users","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reluctance of residents to adopt hems due to associated costs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of willingness to pay for hems leading to slower market growth","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived lack of usefulness of technology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Technology anxiety","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability of renters to make decisions on home improvements","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collection of internet-based survey data with potential for biased responses due to self-selection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survey focused on new york metropolitan area, limiting generalizability to other regions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on self-reported data for perceived risk of covid-19 infection and energy usage","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through in-person data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sanitation and hygiene during data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of personal protective equipment ppe during data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density and communal living may increase the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased electricity consumption during pandemic due to stay-at-home mandates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resemblance of electricity usage curve to that of coronavirus quarantines in u.s. and europe","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Composition of energy usage groups reflecting demographic differences","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants perceiving a low risk of covid-19 infection ≤20%","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential rebounding effects of higher emissions post-pandemic lockdowns","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deprioritization of climate-related issues in global agendas due to the health crisis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive relationship between electricity usage and perceived climate change issues","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in adoption intention for hems energy and wellbeing features during pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants were not willing to pay for certain hems features, potentially impacting the adoption and implementation of these features.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hems features that contribute to reducing community environmental impacts during the covid-19 pandemic were particularly unpopular, indicating a potential lack of interest in sustainability-focused features.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in willingness to pay for different hems features may lead to unequal access to beneficial features based on cost, potentially exacerbating socioeconomic disparities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Comparisons of wtp for hems across electricity-use and risk perception groups may lead to unequal access to health-enhancing features based on perceived risk and electricity use.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of misinformation and misinterpretation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological impact of risk perception","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adoption intention of hems wellbeing features during covid-19 influenced by attitudes, cost concerns, cybersecurity concerns, and demographics such as income, age, and household size.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk perception was found to be positively related to adoption intention of hems with both energy and wellbeing features.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Factors influencing willingness to pay wtp for hems wellbeing features during covid-19, including attitudes, perceived usefulness, and demographic factors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation due to increased use of telemedical services and community updates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased wtp for wellbeing features among older residents","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative impact of technology anxiety on wtp for home security features","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Residents’ willingness to adopt and pay for hems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived risk of getting covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Connection between actions and climate change issues","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low percentage of population viewing climate change as caused by human activities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on reducing non-essential economic activities for tackling covid-19 and climate change","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social-psychological factors influencing hems technology adoption intention and wtp during covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social norms as a strong predictor of adoption intention and willingness to pay for energy-related and well-being features","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variable effects of cost concerns on adoption intention and willingness to pay for energy and well-being features","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationship between trust in utilities and willingness to pay for well-being features","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Small sample size in new york may not be representative of the entire new york city area or other cities in the u.s.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for cultural differences in social distancing, energy burden, access to technology, and healthy built-home environments may lead to biased findings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address social- psychological factors such as perceived fairness and social networks could result in overlooking important risk factors for disease propagation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Household size may impact the propagation of contagious diseases within the home environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk perception and attitudes towards home energy management systems hems may affect the adoption of disease-containment features in the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cybersecurity and technology anxiety may deter the adoption of smart home technologies with disease-containment features.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Highly resistant variants of covid-19 continue to emerge","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
